summary: Supermassive black holes are incredibly large, millions to billions of times bigger than the Sun. They're found at the center of most big galaxies, including our own Milky Way. In 2019, scientists used a special telescope called the Event Horizon Telescope to take the first picture of one in the galaxy Messier 87. The image shows a bright ring of light around a dark center, which is the black hole's "shadow." This proves that these mysterious objects really exist and helps us understand them better.
title: Supermassive black hole
